articles.contents: Jiuke Information, an AI enterprise automation platform spun out from China Zhongjin Group, completed over 100 million yuan in Series B2 funding led by Shenzhen's special economic zone development fund. The startup provides intelligent agent platforms for central state-owned enterprises, with products deployed across 30% of China's central SOEs.
articles.title: 前中金、甲骨文团队再创业，其AI智能自动化平台渗透三成央企，再获亿元融资 | 硬氪首发

articles.contents: Shanghai Zhinuo Technology, a flexible textile pressure sensor developer, raised nearly 100 million yuan in Pre-A funding led by Sequoia Capital's Hidden Gem Fund. The startup uses woven pressure sensing technology for robotics and smart home applications.
articles.title: 科沃斯参股基金投了一家柔性触觉感知公司，产品已上车头部新势力｜硬氪首发

articles.contents: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company's 2nm (N2) advanced chip manufacturing process ramped production to 35,000 wafers monthly in early production, with plans to increase to 140,000 wafers monthly by end of 2025.
articles.title: 台积电2nm量产初期月产能约3.5万片晶圆，2026年底有望达14万片

articles.contents: Low-altitude economy stocks gained investor attention in 2025 as the industry matured, with 5 mid-cap companies including Aerospace Electronics and Aviation Dynamics each receiving over 100 million yuan in institutional investment.
articles.title: 低空经济站上风口，融资资金出手加仓5股

articles.contents: WeChat launched an AI mini-app growth program providing cloud development resources, AI computing power, data analytics, advertising monetization, and traffic incentives through December 2026.
articles.title: 腾讯启动AI小程序成长计划

articles.contents: Tencent's ima AI work platform launched PowerPoint generation features, allowing users to create presentations using personal knowledge bases with one click.
articles.title: 腾讯ima上线PPT生成功能

articles.contents: NetEase's Youdao launched China's first AI video explanation feature in its learning device Youdao AI Answer Pen, enabling AI-generated video lectures from static educational content.
articles.title: 国内首个生成式视频讲解功能上线有道AI答疑笔

articles.contents: President Trump ordered a Chinese-controlled company to divest its acquisition of Emcore Corp.'s aerospace and defense chip assets, citing national security concerns. The action reflects escalating U.S. restrictions on Chinese semiconductor acquisitions.
articles.title: Trump Orders Chinese-Controlled Firm to Unwind Purchase of U.S. Chip Assets

articles.contents: Unable to generate summary—article content behind paywall.
articles.title: AI start-ups take on Google in fight to reshape web browser market

articles.contents: Action&Link, a company specializing in AI-powered immersive gaming controllers, completed a multi-million yuan seed round led by Zhengge Fund. The 28-year-old founder won first place at Xiaohongshu's developer conference with an innovative motion-sensing gaming device.
articles.title: 28岁拿下小红书开发者大会头奖，种子轮获真格投资｜硬氪首发

articles.contents: Zhu Senhua, former head of Huawei Cloud's robotics AI business, founded NeuroGeometry to develop brain-inspired AI for humanoid robots. The startup completed multi-million yuan seed funding from investors including Lean Venture and raised additional Series A from over 10 AI and robotics investors.
articles.title: 华为云具身机器人负责人离职创业，想用脑认知“改造”机器人大脑丨智能涌现独家

articles.contents: Deepshenzhen Boundless Innovation, a spatial intelligence hardware company, completed over 10 million yuan across multiple funding rounds with backing from Li Zexi's XBOTPARK Fund, Gan Jie's Zhixing Fund, and others. The startup develops MetaCam spatial intelligence hardware for robots and autonomous systems.
articles.title: 李泽湘、甘洁和金沙江投了一家空间智能硬件公司，港科大系出身｜硬氪首发

articles.contents: Hardware maker Plaud launched the NotePin S, a $179 AI recording pin with 64GB storage and 20-hour battery life, alongside a desktop transcription app for virtual meetings that competes with Granola and Fathom. The company has sold over 1.5 million AI notetaking devices and is expanding from in-person meeting capture into digital meeting transcription.
articles.title: Plaud launches a new AI pin and a desktop meeting notetaker

articles.contents: Voice AI startup Subtle launched $199 wireless earbuds with proprietary noise isolation models that enable hands-free voice dictation and AI chat across any app, claiming five times fewer transcription errors than AirPods Pro 3 with OpenAI's model. The buds include a one-year iOS/Mac app subscription and target users seeking privacy-preserving voice interfaces.
articles.title: Subtle releases ear buds with its noise isolation models

articles.contents: Unable to generate summary—article content behind paywall.
articles.title: London emerges as frontline in US-China battle over robotaxis

articles.contents: Nvidia's $20 billion strategic licensing deal with Groq signals the end of general-purpose GPUs as the default AI inference solution, reflecting a shift toward specialized silicon optimized for distinct workloads like context-heavy prefill and fast token-generation decode phases. Inference surpassed training in data center revenue for the first time in late 2025, fragmenting demand across specialized architectures.
articles.title: Nvidia just admitted the general-purpose GPU era is ending

articles.contents: Biren Technology, a Chinese GPU developer, nearly doubled in value on its Hong Kong IPO debut despite posting steep financial losses. The stock surge reflects intense investor appetite for AI hardware amid global chip demand.
articles.title: Chinese AI Chipmaker Biren Skyrockets in Hong Kong Trading Debut

articles.contents: Baidu confidentially filed its AI chip subsidiary Kunlunxin for a Hong Kong IPO to capitalize on China's push for homegrown semiconductors amid U.S. export controls. The listing aims to accelerate development of chips for large language models.
articles.title: Baidu’s Chip Unit Kunlunxin Files for Hong Kong IPO to Tap AI Investment Boom

articles.contents: Multiple Chinese AI startups are preparing Hong Kong IPO filings in early January as investor demand for AI infrastructure companies accelerates. The listing wave reflects a competitive push among Chinese firms to secure capital amid geopolitical constraints.
articles.title: The Week Ahead (Jan. 5–11): Chinese AI Startups Line Up for Hong Kong IPOs

articles.contents: Elon Musk's AI chatbot has been found to generate child sexual abuse material, raising serious concerns about content moderation and safety guardrails in the platform.
articles.title: Elon Musk’s AI chatbot generates child sexual images

articles.contents: Meta's Chief AI Scientist Yann LeCun discussed his philosophy on machine intelligence, emphasizing that learning mechanisms are fundamental to developing truly intelligent systems.
articles.title: Computer scientist Yann LeCun: ‘Intelligence really is about learning’

articles.contents: Three-year-old AI data contractor platform Mercor reached a $10 billion valuation by connecting OpenAI and Anthropic with elite former employees from Goldman Sachs, McKinsey, and law firms who earn up to $200/hour to train AI models. CEO Brendan Foody explained how the company's top 10-20% of contractors drive majority model improvements and positions knowledge work training as the economy's future.
articles.title: How AI is reshaping work and who gets to do it, according to Mercor’s CEO

articles.contents: Nvidia invested in 67 VC deals in 2025 (versus 54 in 2024), including a $100 million check into OpenAI's $6.6 billion Series C round at $157 billion valuation, as the $4.6 trillion GPU chipmaker expands its AI ecosystem influence beyond hardware. The company's corporate VC arm NVentures completed 30 deals in 2025, far exceeding prior years.
articles.title: Nvidia’s AI empire: A look at its top startup investments

articles.contents: OpenAI is developing a new audio model architecture launching in Q1 2026 designed for conversational AI devices, featuring improved accuracy, natural emotion, and real-time interruption handling. The effort follows OpenAI's $6.5 billion acquisition of Jony Ive's hardware firm io in May 2025 and positions standalone audio-first devices as the company's next major consumer product.
articles.title: OpenAI Building New Voice Model Ahead of AI Device Launch: Report

articles.contents: Saudi B2B SaaS startup Ballurh raised strategic investment from Falak Angels Network to expand its AI-powered restaurant optimization platform that helps cloud kitchens and restaurants improve pricing and operations. The platform serves over 400 restaurants and manages orders worth more than SAR 1 billion in gross merchandise value.
articles.title: Ballurh secures investment from Falak Angels

articles.contents: xAI launched Grok Business ($30/seat/month) and Grok Enterprise tiers with advanced models (Grok 3, 4, 4 Heavy) and an "Enterprise Vault" isolation layer for SOC 2/GDPR-compliant data protection and customer-managed encryption. The enterprise launch competes with OpenAI and Anthropic offerings but faces regulatory scrutiny over deepfake concerns on xAI's consumer platform.
articles.title: Musk's xAI launches Grok Business and Enterprise with compelling vault amid ongoing deepfake controversy

articles.contents: Chinese AI startup MiniMax launched a $540 million Hong Kong IPO, seeking to raise HK$4.2 billion for its language model and AI services platform. The listing tests investor appetite for capital-intensive AI firms amid growing market competition.
articles.title: MiniMax Kicks Off $540 Million Hong Kong IPO Amid AI Gold Rush

articles.contents: ChangXin Memory Technologies, China's leading memory chipmaker, is raising 29.5 billion yuan ($4.2 billion) in a Shanghai IPO to compete against Samsung, SK Hynix, and Micron. The funding will expand capacity for DRAM and NAND chips needed for AI systems.
articles.title: Memory Chipmaker ChangXin Seeks $4.2 Billion in IPO Amid AI Boom

articles.contents: Moonshot AI raised $500 million in funding but ruled out an imminent IPO, prioritizing financial stability over rushing to public markets amid competition from rivals launching Hong Kong listings. The Chinese LLM company maintains focus on product development and profitability.
articles.title: Moonshot AI Rules Out Quick IPO After Raising $500 Million

articles.contents: SpaceX, OpenAI, and Anthropic are preparing landmark initial public offerings, signaling major shifts in the private AI and space technology sectors toward public capital markets.
articles.title: SpaceX, OpenAI and Anthropic prepare to launch landmark IPOs

articles.contents: OpenAI unified engineering teams to develop an advanced audio model launching in early 2026 that handles interruptions, speaks naturally mid-conversation, and will power an audio-first personal device launching in about a year. The move reflects broader industry shift toward voice interfaces, with Meta, Google, Tesla, and startups like Sandbar also betting on screenless AI companions.
articles.title: OpenAI bets big on audio as Silicon Valley declares war on screens

articles.contents: Alibaba Cloud Intelligence Group expects enterprise AI adoption to surge in early 2026, with corporate AI budgets projected to reach 10 times current IT spending within years. The forecast signals massive growth in cloud infrastructure and AI services demand.
articles.title: Enterprise AI Budgets to Swell Tenfold, Alibaba Cloud Exec Says

articles.contents: OneRobotics, a smart-home AI device maker, raised HK$1.64 billion ($206 million) in a Hong Kong IPO, with the stock debuting flat. The company is betting on AI-powered home robots to capture growth in the connected home market.
articles.title: Smart-Home Startup OneRobotics Lands $206 Million in HK IPO, Bets Big on AI Bots

articles.contents: Shanghai Iluvatar CoreX, a Chinese GPU chipmaker, launched a $475 million Hong Kong IPO amid U.S. sanctions pressures. The AI hardware company is raising capital to expand GPU production for training and inference workloads.
articles.title: Chinese GPU-Maker Iluvatar CoreX Seeks $475 Million in Hong Kong Listing

articles.contents: Chinese AI startup Zhipu AI launched its Hong Kong IPO seeking up to $640 million, valuing the large language model developer at HK$51.8 billion ($6.7 billion). The listing marks a significant test for China's capital-intensive AI sector.
articles.title: Zhipu AI Seeks Up to $640 Million in Hong Kong IPO

articles.contents: Meta acquired Manus, a Singapore-based AI agent startup founded by Chinese entrepreneurs that experienced rapid growth. The acquisition terms were not disclosed.
articles.title: Meta Acquires Chinese-Founded AI Agent Startup Manus

articles.contents: Meta acquired Singapore-based AI agent startup Manus for $2 billion, which generates over $100 million in annual recurring revenue just eight months after launch by automating complex tasks like job screening and portfolio analysis. The acquisition gives Meta a proven AI product generating real revenue to integrate into Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp.
articles.title: Meta just bought Manus, an AI startup everyone has been talking about

articles.contents: SoftBank Group agreed to acquire DigitalBridge, a digital infrastructure investment firm, for $4 billion to build AI data center capacity and expand its ASI (Artificial Super Intelligence) platform vision. The deal values DigitalBridge at $16 per share and closes in H2 2026, positioning SoftBank to capitalize on surging data infrastructure demand from AI.
articles.title: Softbank Buys DigitalBridge for $4 Bn to tap Data Centre Infrastructure

articles.contents: Meta acquired Singapore-based AI agent platform Manus, which generated $100 million annual recurring revenue just eight months after launch, in a deal completed in under ten days while the startup was raising at $2 billion valuation. Manus automates complex workflows including web navigation, data analysis, and integrations with Google Workspace and Notion tools.
articles.title: Manus Skips Funding at $2 Bn Valuation to Join Meta: Report

articles.contents: OpenAI launched Prompt Packs through its Academy platform—curated, role-specific prompt libraries for sales, engineering, HR, government, and education professionals to standardize ChatGPT usage without trial-and-error. The packs contain dozens of ready-to-use workflow templates and are freely available for immediate deployment.
articles.title: OpenAI Unveils Curated Prompt Packs for Sales, IT, HR, Government and More

articles.contents: China's AI market intensified competition in 2025 as internet giants and startups battle for control of users, hardware, talent, and capital, with the competition evolving beyond model training to broader ecosystem dominance.
articles.title: Cover Story: China’s AI Titans Escalate Battle for Control of Digital Gateways

articles.contents: GameByte, an AI-powered platform enabling mobile game studios to create playable games from text prompts in minutes, raised $1 million at a $10 million valuation from Webrazzi GSYF. The startup eliminates manual coding to accelerate game prototyping and testing.
articles.title: Webrazzi GSYF invested $1M in GameByte

articles.contents: Chen Tianqiao, former China's richest man, is investing $1 billion to develop advanced AI systems that simulate human-like intelligence and behavior.
articles.title: Interview: Gaming Tycoon Chen Tianqiao on His $1 Billion Bet to Build ‘Living’ AI

articles.contents: Coforge acquired AI software engineering firm Encora in a $2.35 billion all-stock deal, creating a $2.5 billion technology services company with AI-led engineering, data, and cloud capabilities. The acquisition, which includes Encora's AIVA agentic AI platform and 3,100+ Latin American engineers, projects AI-led product engineering to become a $1.25 billion business by fiscal 2027.
articles.title: Coforge to Acquire Encora in $2.35 Bn All-Stock Mega Deal to Strengthen AI Engineering

articles.contents: Saudi Arabia-based Newera.ai raised $2.1 million in pre-seed funding led by Embark to scale generative AI solutions for enterprise customers in the region. The startup focuses on transforming complex business challenges into production-ready AI solutions with data localization in Saudi Arabia.
articles.title: Newera.ai raises $2.1 million pre-seed to scale generative AI in Saudi Arabia

articles.contents: Hong Kong-listed robot maker UBTech agreed to acquire controlling stake in Zhejiang Fenglong Electric for 1.665 billion yuan ($237 million) to secure a mainland China listing platform for its humanoid robot business.
articles.title: Robot-Maker UBTech Tries for A-Share Foothold With Takeover of Auto Parts Firm

articles.contents: Hangzhou Deep Robotics, a Chinese maker of quadrupedal and humanoid robots, began IPO preparation for a mainland listing as hardware startups rush to access China's buoyant capital markets.
articles.title: Deep Robotics Starts IPO Tutoring for Mainland Listing

articles.contents: UK AI startups raised £1.8 billion in the first half of 2025, with Nscale leading the charge by securing $1.1 billion in a record European Series B to build sovereign AI data centers powered by renewable energy. Other major deals include Isomorphic Labs raising $600 million for AI-driven drug discovery and Nothing securing $200 million for consumer electronics development.
articles.title: £2B+ raised: Ranking the biggest UK AI deals in 2025

articles.contents: Groq, a US chipmaker specializing in AI inference hardware, signed a non-exclusive licensing agreement with NVIDIA, with founder Jonathan Ross and other executives joining NVIDIA to advance the licensed LPU (Language Processing Unit) technology. Groq remains independent with new CEO Simon Edwards, following earlier reports of a failed $20 billion acquisition bid.
articles.title: Groq to Now Help NVIDIA Build Inference Tech

articles.contents: Coforge launched EvolveOps.AI, an agentic AI platform for autonomous IT operations management across hybrid cloud environments, featuring 28 AI personas and fine-tuned language models. Enterprises using the platform recorded 25% reduction in downtime, 40% reduction in IT costs, and 60% faster incident resolution.
articles.title: Coforge Launches EvolveOps.AI, an Agentic AI-Powered IT Operations Platform

articles.contents: Global investment firm IHC acquired 70% of Peko Holdings, an all-in-one digital platform automating financial and administrative processes like payroll, invoicing, and expense management for SMEs and mid-market companies. Peko is integrating AI-powered assistants to automate routine tasks like forecasting and expense management.
articles.title: IHC Invests in Peko Holdings to Accelerate AI-Powered Automation for SMEs

articles.contents: Liquid cooling firm Iceotope uses oil-based fluid immersion and water circulation systems to cool data center chips, reducing cooling energy consumption by up to 80% compared to traditional air cooling. The approach addresses growing demand for data center infrastructure driven by AI while tackling environmental concerns around energy and water usage.
articles.title: The showers and baths keeping data centre tech cool

articles.contents: UAE-based fintech Lucid Capital closed a $2.5 million seed round led by Tharawat Holding and secured $200 million in capital commitments for AI-driven algorithmic trading. The company uses autonomous AI agents and quantitative strategies to optimize trade execution across US equities and digital asset markets.
articles.title: Lucid Capital closes $2.5 million Seed round, led by Tharawat Holding

articles.contents: The x402 protocol enables digital AI agents to autonomously pay for data and products using stablecoins, extending agentic AI capabilities beyond traditional payment constraints.
articles.title: x402 Aims to Enable Agentic Payments With Digital Dollars

articles.contents: Swedish AI startup Lovable raised $330 million in Series B funding, reaching a $6.6 billion valuation for its platform that generates full applications from natural language text prompts.
articles.title: AI Coding Startup Lovable Now Valued at $6.6B

articles.contents: Saudi AI startup QPioneers raised its first funding round from Q Fund (Qewam Holding's investment arm) for an undisclosed amount to develop its Startup OS—an AI-powered workspace combining collaboration tools, operations, and analytics with an intelligent 'QP Agent' assistant. The platform automates workflows and delivers strategic insights for growth-stage startups.
articles.title: Q Fund backs AI startup QPioneers in first funding round

articles.contents: Australian AI startup Edit on the Spot launched a real-time video editing platform that transforms live event footage into branded, captioned clips within seconds while events are still happening. The platform processed 125 live sessions at SXSW Sydney, using AI for speaker detection, brand-safe templating, and live captioning to replace multi-day post-production workflows.
articles.title: Australian AI Event Video Platform Debuts Real-Time Editing at SXSW Sydney

articles.contents: Edison Scientific, a San Francisco-based spinout from FutureHouse, raised $70 million at a $250 million valuation to develop Kosmos, an autonomous AI scientist platform that accelerates research in biology and chemistry by automating literature review, data analysis, and experimental design. The round was co-led by Spark Capital and Triatomic Capital with participation from Google's Chief Scientist Jeff Dean.
articles.title: FutureHouse spinout Edison lands $70M to build autonomous AI scientists for biology and chemistry

articles.contents: Swiss AI engineering platform Neural Concept raised $100 million in Series C funding led by Goldman Sachs Alternatives to scale its CAD-native technology that embeds AI into design and simulation workflows for automotive, aerospace, and semiconductor sectors. The funding will support product development including generative CAD capabilities and expansion of global partnerships.
articles.title: Neural Concept raises $100M to scale AI-native engineering

articles.contents: Lovable, an AI platform enabling non-technical users to build web and software applications through natural language prompts, raised $330 million at a $6.6 billion valuation led by CapitalG and Menlo Ventures. The platform has generated 25 million+ projects with 200+ million monthly visits from enterprises including Klarna and Deutsche Telekom.
articles.title: Lovable raises $330M at a $6.6B valuation to turn non-developers into software builders

articles.contents: Salesforce acquired Qualified, a conversational AI platform, to expand its Agentforce suite and enhance autonomous agent capabilities for marketing and sales automation.
articles.title: Salesforce Buys Qualified in Agentic Marketing Push

articles.contents: Anthropic launched an open Skills standard for Claude, enabling AI agents to independently perform specialized tasks with greater autonomy and flexibility.
articles.title: Anthropic Launches Skills Open Standard for Claude

articles.contents: Google released Gemini 3 Flash, a new enterprise-focused AI model designed to address diverse business needs while simplifying model selection for organizations.
articles.title: Google Releases Gemini 3 Flash Aimed at Enterprises

articles.contents: European startup Wodan AI closed a €2 million pre-seed round led by Spanish and Belgian funds to scale its homomorphic encryption technology enabling AI models to run on encrypted data without decryption. The company is relocating its headquarters to Madrid to advance sovereign AI capabilities for finance, defence, and healthcare sectors.
articles.title: Wodan AI closes a €2M round to advance sovereign AI development in Europe

articles.contents: Copenhagen-based NobodyWho raised €2 million in pre-seed funding to deploy Small Language Models directly on users' devices, eliminating cloud dependency and reducing AI's carbon footprint by up to 500x compared to cloud-based LLMs. The open-source startup enables organizations to run AI locally on laptops and phones while maintaining full data control and privacy.
articles.title: NobodyWho raises €2M to challenge Big Tech’s cloud AI with SLMs for local devices

articles.contents: OpenAI released GPT Image 1.5, an updated image generation tool for ChatGPT that enhances precision, speed, and creative output capabilities.
articles.title: OpenAI Updates ChatGPT Images Tool

articles.contents: Nvidia acquired SchedMD to strengthen its high-performance computing and open source AI portfolio for enterprise workloads.
articles.title: Nvidia Aims to Bolster HPC With Acquisition

articles.contents: UAE-based Relik closed a seed funding round with KBW Ventures and other investors to expand its AI-powered authentication platform that verifies collectibles, art, and cultural assets using a unique 'digital DNA' system. The technology enables verification in seconds without requiring external hardware like NFC chips or QR codes.
articles.title: Relik raises seed round with backing from KBW Ventures

articles.contents: Fynd, an AI-native retail technology platform backed by Reliance Retail, expanded into South Africa by onboarding luxury retailer Surtee Group. The platform unifies offline and online inventory, enables ship-from-store capabilities, and uses AI for personalized customer engagement across channels in a market projected to reach $7.48 billion in e-commerce sales by 2025.
articles.title: Fynd Launches in South Africa to Accelerate Commerce Adoption

articles.contents: Mindoo secured €5 million in seed funding from 6DC, Syndicate One, and angel investors to expand its AI healthcare platform that configures agentic workflows for hospital tasks like patient intake, documentation, and follow-up communication. The startup is deployed across Belgium and Germany with plans to expand into the Netherlands and France.
articles.title: Mindoo raises €5M for AI healthcare workforce platform

articles.contents: AI2 released Molmo 2, open source video understanding models that advance AI's ability to interpret and analyze video content.
articles.title: Ai2 Introduces Molmo 2 Open Video Models

articles.contents: Google released an updated Gemini Deep Research tool that enhances the AI model's ability to conduct comprehensive research tasks.
articles.title: Google Releases Updated Gemini Deep Research

articles.contents: Runware, a 2023-founded startup building unified API infrastructure for generative AI, secured $50 million in funding to improve AI efficiency and accessibility.
articles.title: Runware Secures $50M in Quest to Build 'One API for All AI'

articles.contents: Berlin-based Mirelo raised $41 million in a seed round led by Index Ventures and Andreessen Horowitz to advance its AI sound generation platform that automatically creates synchronized music and audio effects for video content in seconds. The startup's models require 50x less compute than typical LLMs and target individual creators, small studios, and enterprises.
articles.title: AI sound generator startup Mirelo grabs $41M seed round, led by Index and A16z

articles.contents: London-based PolyAI raised $86 million in Series D funding co-led by Georgian, Hedosophia, and Khosla Ventures to expand its AI voice assistant platform for call centers, which serves over 100 enterprise customers including Hilton, Marriott, and FedEx. The University of Cambridge spinout develops conversational AI that handles customer inquiries, payments, and account information with voices tailored by accent and tone.
articles.title: PolyAI raises $86M

articles.contents: Resemble AI, which detects and prevents deepfake creation, raised $13 million in funding led by Google's AI Futures Fund amid rising AI-related fraud in the U.S.
articles.title: AI Startup Raises $13M to Combat Deepfakes

articles.contents: Nvidia released Nemotron 3, open source AI models built on hybrid mixture-of-experts architecture designed to help enterprises deploy multi-agent AI systems.
articles.title: Nvidia Releases Nemotron 3 Open Models

articles.contents: GPU-as-a-service providers are networking AI data centers to meet surging computational demand from agentic AI applications and physical AI systems like robots.
articles.title: Neocloud Providers Look to Network AI Data Centers

articles.contents: British AI company Applied Computing opened its Bangalore office to expand in India's energy market with Orbital, its foundation model built specifically for energy operations optimization. The move includes hiring former Shell VP Dan Jeavons and leverages proven deployments with major refining operators across India.
articles.title: Applied Computing opens Bangalore office as India becomes ground zero for next-gen industrialAI

articles.contents: OpenAI signed a $1 billion deal with Disney and launched ChatGPT 5.2, enabling its Sora video generation tool to access over 200 Disney characters.
articles.title: OpenAI Seals $1B Disney Deal, Launches ChatGPT 5.2

articles.contents: Impartner released Aimi, an AI engine embedded in its partner relationship management platform that automates content creation, voice-to-text record creation, and knowledge asset retrieval. The AI system is designed to streamline partner program workflows by reducing manual tasks and improving data quality for enterprise partner revenue operations.
articles.title: Impartner Unveils Aimi, the Enterprise AI Engine Designed to Elevate Partner Revenue

articles.contents: The Rundown Studio, co-founded by former CNN anchor Zain Verjee, launched an AI-powered prompt library with 12 specialized communications tools designed to help African organizations cut PR costs from $1,500-$20,000 monthly to affordable rates. The platform provides newsroom-tested frameworks for media pitches, press releases, and TV scripts, enabling communications teams across Nairobi, Lagos, and Accra to access world-class expertise without expensive agency retainers.
articles.title: Africa’s PR costs are soaring; ex-CNN anchor Zain Verjee has an AI fix

articles.contents: Rotterdam-based Lynk closed a pre-seed round led by Curiosity VC to scale its AI contract intelligence platform that automates audit tasks, identifies risks, and manages obligations for enterprises and small businesses managing complex agreements. The platform reduces manual administrative work and is currently deployed in Dutch real estate development and contracting sectors.
articles.title: Pre-seed funding fuels Lynk’s expansion of AI-driven contract control platform

articles.contents: UK-based Runware raised $50 million Series A led by Dawn Capital for its unified API platform aggregating multiple AI models for media-creation workflows with lower latency and costs. The startup serves enterprise customers including Wix, Quora, and Together.ai through its Sonic Inference Engine optimized for efficient AI inference.
articles.title: Runware nets $50M Series A for ‘one API for all AI’ platform

articles.contents: Berlin-based Zentio closed €1.4 million pre-seed funding led by HTGF for its AI-native production planning platform that uses agents to optimize real-time manufacturing decisions across interdependent operations. The 2025-founded startup helps factories reduce idle time, improve capacity planning, and respond to disruptions by centralizing operational data through AI systems.
articles.title: Zentio raises €1.4M for AI-native production planning

articles.contents: Amazon committed an additional $35 billion investment in India to build AI infrastructure and develop AI training capabilities in the world's most populous country.
articles.title: Amazon to Spend Another $35B in India, With AI the Focus

articles.contents: Microsoft will invest an additional $5.4 billion in Canada to expand AI and cloud infrastructure, enhance cybersecurity capabilities, and develop local workforce skills in AI technologies.
articles.title: Microsoft to Spend Another $5.4 Billion to Boost AI in Canada

articles.contents: Nvidia's sales of AI chips to China generate U.S. revenue, expand Nvidia's market reach, and allow China to access advanced semiconductors while developing its domestic chip capabilities.
articles.title: Sale of Nvidia AI Chips to China Helps All Parties

articles.contents: Google will launch AI-powered glasses next year featuring audio and display capabilities that deliver screen-free assistance, live translation, and seamless smartphone integration to compete with Meta's Ray-Bans.
articles.title: Google AI Glasses Set to Take on Meta Ray-Bans Next Year

articles.contents: IBM acquired data streaming provider Confluent to leverage real-time data processing capabilities, reflecting the industry shift toward streaming data over static datasets for AI applications.
articles.title: In AI Play, IBM Acquires Data Streaming Provider Confluent

articles.contents: Meta acquired wearable AI startup Limitless, known for its AI-enabled pendant device, advancing Meta's strategy to democratize access to superintelligence through consumer hardware.
articles.title: Meta Acquires Wearable AI Startup Limitless

articles.contents: TechCabal identified 23 African AI startups building foundational infrastructure rather than wrapping existing APIs, including companies developing proprietary language models for local languages, offline-capable AI systems, and hardware optimized for low-connectivity environments. Over 2,400 African startups are building AI infrastructure, with focus shifting from AI adoption to African ownership of models, datasets, and compute infrastructure.
articles.title: 23 startups laying the groundwork for Africa’s AI growth

articles.contents: African AI startups launched 10 notable products in 2025 including Gebeya Dala (mobile-first app builder supporting local languages), Curation AI (real-time deepfake detection), and YarnGPT (multilingual dubbing), reflecting a shift toward AI solutions addressing Africa's specific infrastructure constraints and linguistic diversity. These products demonstrate the continent's move from generic AI experimentation to building contextually relevant applications for emerging markets.
articles.title: 10 exciting African AI products launched in 2025

articles.contents: The New York Times sued AI search startup Perplexity while Meta signed publishing deals, highlighting ongoing disputes over AI companies using publisher content to train large language models without compensation.
articles.title: The NYT Sues Perplexity as Meta Partners With Publishers

articles.contents: Nvidia and Mistral AI partnered to launch a new family of open-source language models optimized on Nvidia's computing platforms, expanding accessible AI model options for developers.
articles.title: Nvidia, Mistral AI Partner to Launch New Family of Open Models

articles.contents: A Saudi Arabian AI startup launched an Arabic-language large language model alongside a platform for creating and managing AI agents, addressing AI capabilities for Arabic-speaking markets.
articles.title: Saudi AI Startup Launches Arabic LLM

articles.contents: Anthropic invested $200 million in data platform Snowflake, demonstrating the independent AI company's significant market influence and vendors' strategic adoption of its Claude models.
articles.title: Snowflake Deal Another Example of Anthropic's Influence

articles.contents: OpenAI acquired AI training startup Neptune to enhance model development capabilities, while Anthropic made its first acquisition by purchasing Bun to advance Claude Code, its agentic coding assistant.
articles.title: OpenAI to Acquire AI Startup Neptune, in Model Training Boost

articles.contents: Nvidia released Alpamayo-R1, an open reasoning AI model unveiled at NeurIPS designed to enable Level 4 autonomous driving by combining human-like reasoning capabilities with self-driving vehicle systems.
articles.title: Nvidia Releases Open Reasoning AI for Self-Driving Vehicles

articles.contents: AWS introduced reinforcement fine-tuning capabilities for users to customize AI models, while expanding its Strands SDK and launching Kiro Powers to simplify agent development.
articles.title: AWS Simplifies Agent Building With Model Customization

articles.contents: AWS released multiple enterprise AI tools at Re:Invent 2025, including AI agents, generative models, a model service, AI factories, and custom AI chips targeting enterprise deployments.
articles.title: AWS Steps up Its AI Game at Re:Invent 2025

articles.contents: DeepSeek released new AI models comparable to competitors, though their performance raises questions about the company's open-source business strategy and long-term monetization approach.
articles.title: DeepSeek's New Models Reveal Open Source Complexities

articles.contents: OpenAI expanded enterprise offerings by deploying ChatGPT Enterprise to Accenture workers and took an ownership stake in healthcare company Thrive Holdings.
articles.title: OpenAI's Latest Moves Aimed at Enterprise AI

articles.contents: AWS released Nova Forge, enabling businesses to create custom AI models that integrate proprietary data while maintaining capabilities from foundational models.
articles.title: AWS Targets AI Maturity in Nova Forge Release

articles.contents: AWS launched Frontier Agents, autonomous AI systems capable of executing multiple concurrent tasks with minimal human intervention.
articles.title: AWS Launches Frontier Agents

articles.contents: Runway released Gen-4.5, a highly realistic video generation model whose advanced capabilities present authentication and content verification challenges for enterprises.
articles.title: Generative AI Startup Runway Releases Gen-4.5 Video Model

articles.contents: Sunday Robotics emerged from stealth with Memo, a household robot trained on human-derived behavioral data rather than simulations.
articles.title: Sunday Robotics Emerges From Stealth With Household Robot

articles.contents: Mathematical AI startup Harmonic raised $120 million and achieved unicorn status valued at $1.45 billion, developing its Aristotle model for error-free advanced reasoning AI.
articles.title: Mathematical Superintelligence Startup Valued at $1.45B

articles.contents: UrSafe, a U.S.-based personal safety startup, signed a memorandum of understanding with Nigeria's Klass Security to deploy drone surveillance as a service rather than requiring schools to purchase expensive drone fleets costing millions of naira. The AI-powered drone system aims to address Nigeria's school kidnapping crisis by providing affordable, scalable threat detection without the infrastructure burden of owning and maintaining autonomous systems.
articles.title: Can AI and drones protect Nigeria’s school children? UrSafe thinks so

articles.contents: Google launched Gemini 3, its most advanced AI model featuring improved long-chain reasoning, multimodal understanding of text, images, video, audio, and code, plus a new "Deep Think" mode that reasons through complex problems. The model includes generative UI capabilities that create adaptive interfaces like interactive trip itineraries and custom learning dashboards across Google's product ecosystem.
articles.title: Here’s everything we know about Google’s Gemini 3

articles.contents: African startups Ubenwa and DeepEcho are using AI to address Sub-Saharan Africa's maternal and neonatal mortality crisis, which accounts for two-thirds of global maternal deaths. Ubenwa analyzes infant cries via smartphone to detect birth asphyxia, while DeepEcho automates fetal ultrasounds trained on 150 million African ultrasound images, enabling non-specialists to perform scans in minutes instead of 30 minutes.
articles.title: Can AI make childbirth safer in Africa? These startups think so

articles.contents: Cognito Systems, founded by Moore Dagogo-Hart, launched Martha AI, a customer service platform that applies emotional-intelligence technology originally built for suicide prevention helplines to detect frustrated customers in African markets. The AI reduced average response times from 30 hours to under 30 seconds on Zap Africa's support tickets by fine-tuning on African conversation patterns and dialects.
articles.title: The Founder Behind Zap Africa, Tested By Suicides & Battles, Is Going Big On AI

articles.contents: Blossom Academy, a Ghanaian startup founded by Jeph Acheampong, trains young Africans in data analytics and AI through fully-funded three-to-four-month courses followed by paid internships, achieving an 85% career placement rate with graduates earning up to $6,500 monthly. The academy has expanded to Nigeria and Rwanda with adapted models targeting unemployed youth, underemployed professionals, and sector-specific training in agriculture, finance, and healthcare.
articles.title: This Ghanaian startup believes data, not degrees, will transform Africa’s workforce

articles.contents: Cairo-based Nanovate raised $1 million in pre-seed funding led by angel investors to develop Arabic AI solutions supporting 22 regional dialects across MENA, including conversational agents and voice systems integrated with enterprise CRM and ERP tools. The startup plans to expand into Saudi Arabia and the UAE while scaling its localized natural language models.
articles.title: Egypt’s Nanovate Raises USD 1 M Pre-Seed To Scale Arabic AI Across MENA

articles.contents: Y Combinator's Summer 2025 batch of 165+ startups reveals AI focus has shifted from experimental tools to production-ready enterprise systems, with 16 companies building specialized voice AI for regulated industries like financial services and 20 focusing on software development agents. Nearly 50% of the cohort offers AI agents, signaling the technology has matured from experimentation to deployment at scale.
articles.title: Y Combinator’s 2025 Summer Batch reveals focus on production-ready AI

articles.contents: Generative engine optimization (GEO) startups are capturing the emerging market for AI search visibility, with native GEO companies founded in 2023-2025 gaining first-mover advantage by offering multi-platform monitoring across ChatGPT, Claude, and Google AI Overviews. Market leaders differentiate through automated content generation, competitive benchmarking, and sentiment analysis as e-commerce traffic from AI platforms surged 4,700% year-over-year.
articles.title: The GEO companies winning the AI search arms race

articles.contents: Large cybersecurity firms completed 8 AI security acquisitions in 2025, including Check Point's acquisition of Lakera and CrowdStrike's purchase of Pangea, targeting early-stage startups that combine red teaming and defensive incident response capabilities. Data pipeline security startups like TrustLogix and Protecto face the highest M&A probability, with acquisition likelihood driven by partnerships with hyperscalers and C-suite talent from Microsoft, Apple, and Google.
articles.title: The AI security gold rush: who will be snapped up next?

articles.contents: Coding AI agents dominate commercialization with Cursor generating $500M in ARR and Replit earning $150M, averaging $1.4M revenue per employee and demonstrating superior capital efficiency. Customer service AI agents command premium valuations at 219x revenue multiples, while the sector's top revenue generators average just 3.8 years old with most already scaling deployments.
articles.title: The AI agent revenue race — September’s top earners show coding dominates commercialization

articles.contents: Brain-computer interface (BCI) funding tripled to $867M in 2025, led by Neuralink's $650M Series E round at a $9.7B valuation, as over 70 clinical studies advance and Precision Neuroscience achieved the first FDA clearance for BCI-assisted neurosurgery in March 2025. The industry is accelerating toward commercial deployment with rapid clinical validation and substantial investor backing.
articles.title: Brain-computer interface startups race toward commercial deployment: Here are the leading players

articles.contents: Cairo-based Intella raised $12.5 million in a Series A round led by Prosus to scale its Arabic dialect speech recognition technology, achieving 95.73% accuracy across 25+ dialects and serving enterprise contact centers in MENA. The funding accelerates development of Ziila, its AI agent platform that helps businesses improve customer experience by converting conversations into strategic business assets.
articles.title: Egypt’s Intella Raises USD 12.5 M Series A For Arabic Dialect AI

articles.contents: Mitti Labs, a New York-based startup, uses AI-powered models to measure methane emissions from rice paddies and has partnered with The Nature Conservancy to train farmers in climate-friendly practices across India. The company monetizes through carbon credits, delivering approximately 15% income improvements to smallholder farmers while offering measurement, reporting, and verification as a SaaS solution.
articles.title: How one AI startup is helping rice farmers battle climate change

articles.contents: Harvard dropouts AnhPhu Nguyen and Caine Ardayfio launched Halo, AI-powered smart glasses that continuously record and transcribe conversations while providing real-time contextual information, after raising $1M led by Pillar VC. The $249 glasses, available for preorder, position themselves as privacy-focused competitors to Meta's smart glasses by leveraging AI to enhance memory and decision-making during conversations.
articles.title: Harvard dropouts to launch ‘always on’ AI smart glasses that listen and record every conversation

articles.contents: Obvio, a San Carlos startup, raised $22M Series A from Bain Capital Ventures to expand AI-powered cameras at stop signs that detect unsafe driving and improve pedestrian safety. The company uses enforcement technology inspired by successful international models while building privacy protections to limit surveillance risks in five initial U.S. cities.
articles.title: Obvio’s stop sign cameras use AI to root out unsafe drivers

articles.contents: Gridcare raised $13.5M seed funding led by Xora to identify and unlock hidden grid capacity for AI data centers by using generative AI to forecast power availability and match utilities with hyperscalers. The Stanford-founded startup maps electrical grids across fiber, water, and permitting factors to solve data center power shortages without requiring years-long utility interconnection waits.
articles.title: Gridcare thinks more than 100 GW of data center capacity is hiding in the grid

articles.contents: Nvidia partnered with EPRI and the Open Power AI Consortium—including PG&E, Con Edison, Microsoft, and Oracle—to develop open-source domain-specific AI models addressing electrical grid challenges created by surging data center demand. The initiative responds to electricity demand expected to grow 4% annually as AI computing power needs intensify.
articles.title: Nvidia thinks AI can solve electrical grid problems caused by AI

articles.contents: Microsoft signed a deal with AES for three solar projects delivering 475 megawatts across Illinois, Michigan, and Missouri to power AI data centers, bringing its renewable portfolio to over 34 GW. The expansion reflects solar's cost-effectiveness and quick deployment advantages over nuclear and natural gas plants for rapidly scaling data center power needs.
articles.title: Solar notches another win as Microsoft adds 475 MW to power its AI data centers

articles.contents: ElevenLabs, a voice AI company that raised $180 million last month, launched a publishing platform letting authors create and distribute AI-narrated audiobooks through its Reader app, paying roughly $1.10 per listener for 11+ minutes of engagement. The move aims to undercut Audible's royalty rates and democratize audiobook production by eliminating expensive studio costs.
articles.title: ElevenLabs now lets authors create and publish audiobooks on its own platform

articles.contents: YouTube is rolling out auto-dubbing to all Partner Program creators this month, enabling one-click translation into multiple languages, alongside AI age-detection and expanded Content ID tools that identify AI-generated deepfakes of creators' faces and voices. CEO Neal Mohan named AI as one of the platform's four major 2025 bets.
articles.title: YouTube AI updates include auto dubbing expansion, age ID tech, and more

articles.contents: San Diego-based Self Inspection raised $3 million in seed funding led by Costanoa Ventures and DVx Ventures to scale its AI-powered vehicle inspection platform, which uses smartphone cameras and OBD2 data to detect damage and generate inspection reports for auto lenders and dealerships. The company already counts Avis and CarOffer as customers in the $30 billion inspection market.
articles.title: Self Inspection raises $3M for its AI-powered vehicle inspections

articles.contents: Meta signed a 595-megawatt solar power deal with Spanish developer Zelestra in Texas, adding nearly 5% to its 12+ gigawatts of renewable capacity under contract. The purchase supports Meta's $60 billion 2025 capital spending plan focused on AI data center infrastructure needed for its Llama 4 model development.
articles.title: Meta turns to solar — again — in its data center-building boom

articles.contents: Menlo Ventures and Anthropic launched the $100 million Anthology Fund to invest in AI-first applications and infrastructure built on Anthropic's technology across infrastructure, consumer experiences, and trust and safety. The fund, which invests from seed stage onwards with minimum checks of $100,000, reflects growing momentum in creating AI-focused venture vehicles.
articles.title: Menlo Ventures And Anthropic Open $100M Fund

articles.contents: San Jose-based DreamBig Semiconductor raised $75 million led by Samsung Catalyst Fund to develop chiplet platforms optimized for large language models and generative AI applications. The funding reflects strong venture interest in specialized AI chips as the industry seeks more cost-effective and energy-efficient semiconductor solutions.
articles.title: DreamBig Latest Chip Startup To Go Big — Raises $75M

articles.contents: Pittsburgh-based robotics AI startup Skild AI raised $300 million in Series A funding led by Coatue, Lightspeed, SoftBank, and Jeff Bezos at a $1.5 billion valuation. The company develops reusable AI brain models for robots rather than single-application robots, addressing a fundamental need in the robotics industry.
articles.title: The Week’s 10 Biggest Funding Rounds: Skild AI Grabs $300M To Build Robot Brains

articles.contents: Germany-based defense tech startup Helsing raised $489 million at a $5.4 billion valuation led by General Catalyst to develop AI software that enhances weapons capabilities in drones and fighter jets while improving battlefield decision-making. The company has become active supporting Ukraine and Baltic nations amid renewed security concerns in Eastern Europe.
articles.title: Defense Tech Startup Helsing Raises at $5.4B Valuation

articles.contents: San Francisco-based Hayden AI raised $90 million in a growth equity round led by The Rise Fund to expand its vision AI platform that uses cameras to detect parking violations and collect geospatial data. The platform has demonstrated significant impact in New York City, achieving 5% faster bus speeds and 20% fewer vehicle collisions.
articles.title: Hayden AI Raises $90M To Make Sure You Don’t Park There

articles.contents: New York-based AI startup Hebbia raised $130 million in Series B funding led by Andreessen Horowitz, valuing the company at $700 million. The platform helps enterprises analyze structured and unstructured data to answer complex multi-step business questions from regulatory filings and PDFs.
articles.title: AI Startup Hebbia Locks Up $130M Series B Led By a16z
